Class B Subnetting Example

177.80.0.0 (Requirement:8 networks, how many hosts per network? ________)
255.255.0.0

(Subnet for 8 networks, determine number of hosts per network.)
177.80.0.0 = 10101001.01010000.00000000.00000000
255.255.0.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000

1. Determine Network Portion: 1st 16 bits: 177.80.x.x (2nd 16 bits would be HOST bits)

2. Determine Number of Bits to Borrow from Host bits: 8 networks requires 3 bits
	000,001,010,011,100,101,110,111

3. Determine new subnet mask for 8 subnets: 255.255.224.0 (leaves 13 bits for HOST bits)


4. Determine the 8 new subnets:

1st Network
177.80.0.0    = 10101001.01010000.00000000.00000000 	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000 	(SubnetMask) (/19)
			177.80.0.1 - 177.80.31.254	(Range)
177.80.31.255 = 10101001.01010000.00011111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

2nd Network
177.80.32.0   = 10101001.01010000.00100000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.32.1 - 177.80.63.254	(Range)
177.80.63.255 = 10101001.01010000.00111111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

3rd Network
177.80.64.0   = 10101001.01010000.01000000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.00000000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.64.1 - 177.80.95.254	(Range)
177.80.64.0   = 10101001.01010000.01011111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

4th Network
177.80.96.0   = 10101001.01010000.01100000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.96.1 - 177.80.127.255	(Range)
177.80.127.255   = 10101001.01010000.01111111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

5th Network
177.80.128.0  = 10101001.01010000.10000000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.128.1 - 177.80.159.254	(Range)
177.80.159.0  = 10101001.01010000.10011111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

6th Network
177.80.160.0  = 10101001.01010000.10100000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.160.1 - 177.80.191.254	(Range)
177.80.191.255  = 10101001.01010000.10111111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

7th Network
177.80.192.0  = 10101001.01010000.11000000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.192.1 - 177.80.224.254	(Range)
177.80.223.255  = 10101001.01010000.11011111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

8th Network
177.80.224.0 = 10101001.01010000.11100000.00000000	(NetworkID)
255.255.224.0 = 11111111.11111111.11100000.00000000	(SubnetMask)
			177.80.224.1 - 177.80.255.254	(Range)
177.80.255.255 = 10101001.01010000.11111111.11111111	(BroadcastID)

5. Determine the number of host per network: # of Network bits = 19
	-   32 - 19 = 13bits = 2^13 = 8190 hosts per network
